News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure Gets Listing Approval
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure India Limited receives in-principle approval from BSE and NSE for listing 71,037,388 equity shares of Rs. 10 each issued on preferential basis at premium of Rs. 76.94.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure Board Meet on Feb 13, 2026
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure India Limited schedules board meeting for February 13, 2026 to consider Q3FY26 unaudited financial results. Trading window closed from January 1, 2026.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure Open Offer at ₹97.60/Share
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure India Limited faces mandatory open offer for 66.81 lakh equity shares at ₹97.60 per share by Vikram Sharma and associates, triggered by preferential allotment under SEBI SAST regulations.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure Allots ₹25 Cr Debentures
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure India Limited's board approved allotment of 250 secured non-convertible debentures worth ₹25 crores to InRe Fund II on private placement basis with 20% annual interest rate.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure Wins ₹71.30 Cr Contract
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure secures major excavation and shore piling contract for One Forest Avenue project in Powai from Brookfield-backed BSS Property Ventures and Rajeshwar Property Ventures.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure India Secures INR 71.31 Crore Contract for Excavation and Shore Piling Works in Powai
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure India Limited has been awarded a INR 71.31 crore contract by BSS Property Ventures Private Limited and Rajeshwar Property Ventures Private Limited for major excavation and shore piling works at One Forest Avenue, Powai. The 12-month project involves excavation of 4,50,000 cubic meters of soil and rock plus 300mm diameter shore piling work, representing the first phase of a larger development.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure Reports ₹6,306 Crore Profit After Debt Settlement, Appoints New Director
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure India Limited posted a profit of ₹6,306 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, driven by exceptional gains of ₹6,466 crore from debt settlement under its approved scheme of arrangement. The company appointed Mr. Chander Parkash Sharma as Additional Non-Executive Director and approved issuance of ₹45 crore Non-Convertible Debentures on private placement basis.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure Reports ₹39,989 lakhs Net Loss for Quarter Ended June 30, 2025
News.Summary: Supreme Infrastructure India Limited reported a net loss of ₹39,989.13 lakhs for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company's accumulated losses reached ₹7,19,053.25 lakhs, with full erosion of net worth. The auditors issued a modified review conclusion citing concerns over trade receivables of ₹75,814.87 lakhs outstanding for substantial periods without expected credit loss adjustments. Two subsidiary companies - Supreme Infrastructure BOT Private Limited and Supreme Panvel Indapur Tollways Private Limited - have been admitted to Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process, with investments and receivables totaling ₹142,556.84 lakhs and ₹15,677.22 lakhs respectively. The company has defaulted on borrowing repayments and provided corporate guarantees of ₹1,53,315.69 lakhs for subsidiary borrowings. Despite material uncertainty about going concern, management believes the business can continue based on a partial implementation of a Scheme of Arrangement and other mitigating factors.

News.Title: Supreme Infra Secures 4.50 Billion Rupees Contract in Mumbai
News.Summary: Supreme Infra has been awarded a turnkey contract worth 4.50 billion rupees in Mumbai. The company reports that this new contract has increased their order book to 17.25 billion rupees.

News.Title: Supreme Infra Secures 4.50 Billion Rupees Contract in Mumbai
News.Summary: Supreme Infra has won a contract worth 4.50 billion rupees in Mumbai. This new contract has increased the company's order book to 17.25 billion rupees. The news indicates a significant business development for Supreme Infra, potentially improving its financial outlook.

News.Title: NCLT Approves Amalgamation Scheme for Supreme Infrastructure India
News.Summary: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has approved a scheme of amalgamation between Supreme Infrastructure India and its creditors. This corporate action is a significant development for the company, potentially impacting its financial structure and operations.

News.Title: Supreme Infrastructure India: NCLT Approves ₹2,200 Crore Debt Settlement Plan
News.Summary: NCLT has approved Supreme Infrastructure India's settlement plan for ₹2,200 crore debt. The plan includes ₹464 crore payable to financial creditors, with ₹183.29 crore from asset monetization, ₹147.23 crore from equity raising, and ₹133.48 crore from pledged asset monetization.
